body:
Square One/AutoDesk recommends using Ecotect with Desktop Radiance.   
It is old, but if it is still available, it will resolve these  
issues.  Their instructions--I hope they still work--are here: <http://squ1.org/wiki/Installing_Radiance_Tutorial 
 >.  If you want to use a more current Radiance, try copying "rvu" to  
"rview"; it is unlikely that you have "vi" on your Windows system to  
create a name conflict.


Randolph


On Feb 13, 2009, at 5:57 PM, Krystyna Zelenay wrote:
